dataset.name: _111_pem_for_information
dataset.description:
0.3 Amends made after project board and assurance committee approval

0.4 Amends made for publication, frozen as v1.0 final draft for publication

concept.name: person_demographics
concept.implementationGuidance:
The mandatory information in this section is person’s name, date of birth and address. There can be multiple addresses associated with a person including temporary and correspondence addresses. These are stored on the PDS. <br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The person's details and contact information.

concept.name: person_name
concept.description: Details of the person's name

concept.name: person_first_name
concept.description: The first name(s) of the person. This includes middle names.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person given name

concept.name: person_family_name
concept.description: The family name or surname of the person
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - Person family name

concept.name: person_preferred_name
concept.description: The name by which a person wishes to be addressed. The preferred name volunteered by the person or a preferred name given by PDS that the person has asked to be called by.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person full name

concept.name: title
concept.description: Person's title
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person Title

concept.name: person_name_suffix
concept.description: A textual suffix that may be added to the end of a PERSON's name, for example, OBE, MBE, BSc, JP, GM
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - Person suffix

concept.name: person_full_name
concept.description: The full name of the person in text representation.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person full name

concept.name: date_of_birth
concept.description: The date of birth of the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- Person birth date

concept.name: gender
concept.implementationGuidance: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other activities. Section 22 of the Gender Reassignment Act 2004 makes it an offence to disclose the history of a transgender patient who has had formal gender reassignment under the Act, unless consent has been sought. The exemption of disclosure is for medical professionals involved in direct medical care, but not currently for administrative and non-medical staff. For the full Act, see https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2004/7/contents. This risk can be mitigated by appropriate implementation; refer to the 111 Referral clinical safety case report and hazard log. One option is to leave out the “Sex” field but the implications and potential risks of that will need to be considered. The alternative is to ensure the design, including its Information Governance model, reduces this risk to an acceptable level as described in the clinical safety case and hazard log. A further mitigation on implementation could be to record self-expressed gender in the administrative area of systems, and record sex at birth in a separate clinical area, that can only be accessed by medical staff.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The person's stated gender.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Person stated gender code

concept.name: ethnicity
concept.implementationGuidance: This is not a mandatory field but is a required field due to it's importance in the care of an individual and understanding la persons individual level of risk based on  ethnicity related illness.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The ethnicity of the person as specified by the person.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Ethnic category

concept.name: religion
concept.description: The religious affiliation as specified by the person.

concept.name: sex
concept.implementationGuidance: The persons phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically The definitions used for sex and gender use the NHS data dictionary definitions to ensure interoperability with other systems. However, we recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team in NHS Digital who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards. Sex and gender data items may cause accidental disclosure of gender reassignment without consent. This is because both fields are included in the demographic model. Having both may show a difference and therefore disclose gender reassignment without consent. It is unlawful to disclose, without consent, a person’s gender reassignment with or without a gender reassignment certificate recognise that the definitions used do not reflect today’s more inclusive society. We have provided feedback on this to NHS data dictionary team in NHS Digital who are actively addressing this area, and any updates to the NHS data dictionary will update our standards<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The person’s phenotypic sex. Determines how the person will be treated clinically.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary: - person phenotypic sex

concept.implementationGuidance: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other health & care requirements<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The unique identifier for a person within the NHS in England and Wales.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary:- NHS number

concept.name: immigration_status
concept.implementationGuidance: Details of the immigration status of the person to be included (e.g. asylum seeker, indefinite leave to remain in the UK). Include start date, end date and any comments<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Include details of the immigration status of the person, their permissions to live and receive care and support in the UK e.g. asylum seeker, indefinite leave to remain in the UK. Include start date, end date and any comments.

concept.name: immigration_status
concept.description: Details of the immigration status of the person, their permissions to live and receive care and support in the UK e.g. asylum seeker, indefinite leave to remain in the UK.
concept.valueSets: Code :- 1: Asylum Seeker; 2: Exceptional leave to remain in UK; 3: Indefinite Leave to Remain in UK ;4: Limited Leave to Remain in UK; 5: No Recourse to Public Funds (NRPF); 6: Other Nationals; 7: Refugee; 8: Unaccompanied Asylum Seeker; 9 EU pre-settled status; 10: EU settled status

concept.name: end_date
concept.description: End date of immigration status

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Relevant comments about the person's immigration status

concept.name: organ_and_tissue_donation

concept.name: overseas_visitor_status

concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary :- Overseas visitor charging catergory

concept.name: gp_practice
concept.description: Details of the person's GP practice.

concept.name: gp_practice_record_entry
concept.description: This is an GP practice record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: gp_name
concept.description: The name of the person's GP. If the person is registered with a GP practice, their usual GP name will be something volunteered by the person or their representative.

concept.name: gp_practice_details
concept.description: Name and address of the person's registered GP Practice. Registered GP practice details are available from the Person Demographics Service (PDS), or volunteered from the person or their representative. Include details of the practice name and address.

concept.name: gp_practice_identifier
concept.description: The identifier of the registered GP practice.
concept.valueSets: NHS data dictionary : - General medical practice code (patient registration)

concept.name: gp_opt_out_indicator
concept.description: Indication that the person has opted out of registering with a GP.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - 1092961000000104 |Does not wish to register with an NHS general practitioner (finding)| OR 1092941000000100 |Family using private general practitioner (finding)|

concept.name: individual_requirements
concept.implementationGuidance: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other health and care activities. This section allows for the sharing of any individual requirements the person may have, such as to support cognitive impairment or mobility issues. This may relate to special needs and would extend to include a record of reasonable adjustments. Specific disabilities would be included in the ’Problem list’ section however the requirements to support the disabilities (e.g. needs wheelchair access, needs large print etc.) would be included in this section. The accessible information requirements information would be the most recent requirement rather than a history of requirements.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The individual requirements of the person.

concept.name: reasonable_adjustment
concept.implementationGuidance: This is not mandatory for providing care but is deemed as a 'Must have' to support other health and care. This includes an individuals requirement for soft lighting, no noise a quite room etc.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: A record of reasonable adjustments that must be provided by the service to comply with the Equality Act 2010.

concept.name: reasonable_adjustment_record_entry
concept.description: This is a reasonable adjustment record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items

concept.name: reasonable_adjustment_flag
concept.description:
Under the Equality Act 2010, organisations have a legal duty to make changes in their approach or provision to ensure that services are as accessible to people with disabilities as they are for everybody else. These changes are called reasonable adjustments.

Reasonable adjustments can mean alterations to buildings by providing lifts, wide doors, ramps and tactile signage, but may also mean changes to policies, procedures and staff training to ensure that services work equally well for people with physical or sensory disabilities, learning disabilities or long-term conditions such as dementia.

Other adjustments include longer appointments, providing easy read materials or communications via a carer. This legal duty is anticipatory which means a service should know about a person’s need for adjustments when they are referred or present for care. For this to happen, and for optimum care to be delivered, adjustments need to be recorded and shared across the NHS.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 1108111000000107 |Requires reasonable adjustments for health and care access (Equality Act 2010) (finding)|

concept.name: reasonable_adjustment
concept.description: The reasonable adjustment required e.g. requires specific contact method, requires communication professional

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for reasonable adjustment
concept.valueSets:
SNOMED CT : - Accessible information standard
^999002121000000109 |Accessible information - communication support simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
^999002151000000104 |Accessible information - requires communication professional simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
^999002131000000106 |Accessible information - requires specific contact method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
^999002141000000102 |Accessible information - requires specific information format simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|
Refsets for other categories in development

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: reasonable_adjustment_additional_detail
concept.description: Further detail about the support required and the consequence of not providing it.

concept.name: safeguarding
concept.implementationGuidance: This section includes any concerns in relation to safeguarding and is applicable to children and adults. This section includes whether a child is looked after and indicates the presence of a Child Protection Plan or Unborn Child Protection Plan. There may be situations where it is not advisable to share information in this section with the person to whom it relates, so local implementations may need to apply filters in these cases. Appropriate policies and technical solutions need to be in place for these situations. Access must be controlled to this information as per SCCI1609: Child Protection - Information Sharing. <br clear="none"/>

concept.name: contact_details

concept.name: person_referral_reference
concept.implementationGuidance:
The aim of this element is for it to be given to the patient by the referrer (Sender) service so they can take it to the service they are referred to (Receiver service), providing a link for the patient between the two services. Additionally, it’s a useful point of reference for the two services should they need to speak to each other about the patient’s care.

BaRS have implemented a mechanism (in FHIR messaging) whereby when the Sender makes a referral request, they receive the human readable reference in the synchronous response. The Sender makes the request, the Receiver accept it and processes into their system and sends back a response to the Sender with the human readable reference to say it was successful.
concept.description: A human-readable reference given to the person to use when contacting or going to the service referred on to. It is generated by the receiving service and supplied to the referrer as part of the Booking and Referral Standard (BaRS) messaging.

concept.name: journey_id
concept.implementationGuidance: This reference is to help support tracking of patients/people on multiple referrals through the system.
concept.description: This is a machine-readable reference which the Sender of any initial referral (i.e. it was not sent to them as a referral) generates and includes in their referral request. If the sender is not the initial referrer (i.e. they received a referral) they must include the original reference in their referral.
concept.valueSets: This should be a globally unique identifier (GUID) value. https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/guiddef/ns-guiddef-guid

concept.name: referral_type
concept.description: An indication of the type of referral (e.g. 'Hospital Discharge Notification to Social Care', 'GP Referral', etc.)

concept.name: referral_method
concept.implementationGuidance: <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The method in which a referral is sent and received. This may be a letter, email, transcript of a telephone conversation, Choose and Book, in person (self-referral) etc.
concept.valueSets:
Allow National Codes only
  1. Fax
  2. Phone
  3. Secure Messaging
  4. Secure Email
  5. Letter
  6. NHS E-Referral Service
  7. Self referral

concept.name: referral_criteria
concept.description: Records whether specific criteria required for referral, to a particular service, have been met (may be nationally or locally determined). This field is used to outline which criteria have been met where a service has indicated specific criteria and to explain the rationale for referral where criteria have not been met.

concept.name: return_response_to
concept.description: Name of professional to be communicated with, if not the referrer

concept.name: presenting_complaints_or_issues
concept.implementationGuidance:
This section is used in multiple Information Standards and in general terms describes the complaint or issues as perceived by the individual reporting the complaint or issue, including the referrer.   A person can have multiple complaints or issues recorded in an Information Standard.<br clear="none" style="box-sizing: border-box;"/>
                                <br clear="none" style="box-sizing: border-box;"/>This will be the Symptom Group (SG) or the Symptom Discriminator (SD) code description. This will replace the Chief Complaint code set<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Presenting complaints or issues

concept.name: presenting_complaint_or_issue
concept.description: The health problem or issue experienced by the person resulting in their attendance. This may include disease state, medical condition, response and reactions to therapies. e.g., blackout, dizziness, chest pain, follow up from admission, falls, a specific procedure, investigation or treatment.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for presenting complaint or issue
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: chief_complaint
concept.implementationGuidance:
Should a person describe multiple complaints, this allows for the clinician to capture the complaint the clinician regards as the main complaint. <br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/> This will be the textual detail from the Symptom Group (SG) and Symptom Discriminator (SD) code description. This will replace Chief Complaint Code set<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The nature of the person's chief complaint as assessed by the care professional first assessing the person. Only ONE (chief complaint) sent as per the Chief Complaint code set (SNOMED CT).

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value of the chief complaint
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - 991401000000107 | Emergency care presenting complaints or issues simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Any free text if no coded value is available

concept.name: person_reported_complaints_or_issues
concept.implementationGuidance: Person stated description of the health problems and issues. This may differ from the clinicians impression. This may also be expressed on behalf of the person, eg by parent or carer<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Person stated description of the health problems and issues. This may differ from the clinicians impression. This may also be expressed on behalf of the person, eg by parent or carer.

concept.name: repeat_caller
concept.description: Repeat caller, if the person has called more than twice in 96 hours.

concept.name: addtional_information_sources
concept.implementationGuidance: As well as specifying the source of information or a link to the source, this can also be used to include local information which might not be available to the referring destination, e.g. Special Patient Notes.   <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The source of additional relevant information about the person e.g. summary care record or link via NRL or copy and paste local record e.g. Special Patient Notes (SPN)

concept.name: problem_list
concept.implementationGuidance: This section allows for all the Chief Clinical Concern; problems and issues to be recorded. The Referral / PEM should inform the receiver of the main problem(s) / issues that were important during the 111 encounter<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.

concept.name: problem_list_record_entry
concept.description:
This is a problem list record entry. <br clear="none"/>
                        <br clear="none"/>There may be 0 to many record entries under problem list. <br clear="none"/>
                        <br clear="none"/>Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: problem
concept.implementationGuidance:
The CAS clinician may identify and wish to share a Chief Clinical Concern following a 111 encounter. This section allows for all relevant problems, and issues. This would include disabilities, including learning disabilities, and conditions such as autism where they fall into the above categories i.e., are diagnosed, seen as a problem by the person or are considered a condition or similar. Behavioural factors which are not formal diagnoses but could be seen as a problem for the person would also appear under this section. <br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/>When a diagnosis has not yet been made, the most granular clinical concept with the highest level of certainty should be displayed. This may be a problem, symptom, sign, or test result, and may evolve over time, as a conventional diagnosis is reached. For example, when a patients ‘presenting complaints or issues’ are indigestion and belching,
                                ‘dyspepsia’ may be deemed the ‘Chief Complaint’, the 111 clinicians ‘Chief Clinical Concern’ maybe a ‘gastric ulcer’. Which would require endoscopy, and the subsequent biopsies to confirm the diagnosis of a gastric ulcer.<br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/>Unconfirmed or excluded diagnoses should not be include in structured coded fields but may be included in free text in the comments field. Thus, in the example above, gastric ulcer and gastric cancer may be in a list of differential diagnoses at presentation, but the symptom, dyspepsia, should be included in the diagnosis field. The differential diagnoses should only be included in free text in the comments field, and not in a coded diagnosis field until confirmed with confidence.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description:
A condition which needs addressing and so is important for every professional to know about when seeing the person. <br clear="none"/>
                            <br clear="none"/>Problems may include diagnoses, symptoms, and social or behavioural issues

concept.name: coded_value
concept.implementationGuidance: SNOMED CT allows the coding of Problems which may also be ‘diagnoses’ or ‘issues’, depending on the context in which they are recorded, some codes may need to be 'qualified' by a number of attributes e.g. grade; severity; distribution; behaviour; laterality etc. e.g. Problem: Migraine Qualifier: SuspectedDue to limitations in how the receiving organisations ingest and present Qualifiers i.e. Not all systems can ingest the 'qualifier' into the receiving system. Qualifiers should not be used when coding an unconfirmed / suspected diagnosis. As this may result in a diagnosis being incorrectly coded in to the individuals EHR.To prevent incorrect coding of a diagnosis in the patients electronic health record it is recommended that any suspected diagnosis should be captured in free text only, until the issue is resolved.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: The coded value for the problem list.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: free_text
concept.implementationGuidance: Free text field to be used if coding is not available or when the chief clinical concern; problem or issue requires a qualifier i.e. gastric ulcer - 'suspected'<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: onset_date
concept.implementationGuidance: This is the date of onset of the chief clinical concern; problem or issues<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: A date or estimated date that the problem began

concept.name: clinical_summary
concept.implementationGuidance: A brief summary of the 111 encounter. This may include interpretation of the persons complaints and issues, using the chief complaint and the chief clinical concern. The summary may also list specific action(s). Planned actions will be recorded under ‘plan’.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Clinical Summary

concept.name: clinical_narrative
concept.implementationGuidance: This is a text field to allow the clinician to explain the persons situation and outcome of the encounter.  The clinician may add additional information that they feel is relevant to share with the receiving service / GP<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: A description detailing a patient’s reason for attendance, results from the diagnostic and treatment process.

concept.name: risks
concept.description: Details of any risks related to the person.

concept.name: risks_record_entry
concept.description: This is a risks record entry. There may be 0 to many record entry/entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: start_date_of_risk
concept.description: The start date of the risk.

concept.name: end_date_of_risk
concept.description: The date the risk ended.

concept.name: risk
concept.description: The risk to the person or others, this includes any risk the person might cause to themselves or to others. e.g. suicide, self harm.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for risk.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <281694009 |Finding of at risk (finding)|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Additional details about the risk.

concept.name: allergies_and_adverse_reactions
concept.implementationGuidance: This is for person reported allergies or adverse reactions which may not be on the persons electronic health record. It is NOT to transfer the person's recorded allergies which the receiver can look up (e.g. via SCR, GP Record or shared care record). The full section has been kept for consistency even if only some of the elements are needed for this use case.  <br clear="none"/>
concept.description: Allergies and adverse reactions

concept.name: allergies_and_adverse_reactions_record_entry
concept.description:
This is a allergies and adverse reactions record entry. There may be 1 to many record entries under a section. <br clear="none"/>
                        <br clear="none"/>Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: type_of_reaction
concept.description: The type of reaction experienced by the person (allergic, adverse, intolerance)
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set :- Allergy, Intolerance

concept.name: causative_agent
concept.description: The agent such as food, drug or substances that has caused or may cause an allergy, intolerance or adverse reaction in this person Or “No known drug allergies or adverse reactions” Or “Information not available”

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for causative agent
concept.valueSets:
dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP, AMPP and ingredient concept classes
SNOMED CT : - <105590001 |Substance OR <373873005 |Pharmaceutical / biologic product| OR <<716186003 |No known allergy| OR 196461000000101 |Transfer-degraded drug allergy| OR 196471000000108 |Transfer-degraded non-drug allergy)

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: reaction_details_cluster
concept.description: Details of the reaction.

concept.name: substance
concept.description: The substance, or a class of substances, that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for substance
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - <105590001 | Substance (substance) | or <373873005 | Pharmaceutical / biologic product (product) |

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: description_of_reaction
concept.description: A description of the manifestation of the allergic or adverse reaction experienced by the person. For example, skin rash.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for description of reaction.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^1127581000000103 |Health issues simple reference set|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: onset_date
concept.description: Date and time when manifestations showed e.g could be at home a few days earlier than the contact

concept.name: severity
concept.description: A description of the severity of the reaction.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for severity

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: certainty
concept.description: A description of the certainty that the stated causative agent caused the allergic or adverse reaction.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for certainty.

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: route_of_exposure
concept.description: The route the person was exposed to the substance

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for route of exposure
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Any additional comment or clarification about the adverse reaction.

concept.name: evidence
concept.description: Results of investigations that confirmed the certainty of the diagnosis. Examples might include results of skin prick allergy tests

concept.name: date_first_experienced
concept.description: When the reaction was first experienced i.e this may not be the first time this has happened. May be a date or partial date (e.g. year) or text (e.g. during childhood)

concept.name: allergy_end_date
concept.description: The date the allergy was diagnosed as ended

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Any further comments on the person's allergies or adverse reactions.

concept.name: medications_and_medical_devices
concept.implementationGuidance:
This is a generic section for recording all types of medication including those prescribed by healthcare professionals and administered by a person (or their carer).

The medications section allows for using structured dose and timing information that is machine readable to facilitate the reading and transfer of medications information between systems and providers of care, through the structured dose direction cluster. Technical guidance for implementing the structured dose and timing in Fast Healthcare Interoperable Resource (FHIR) messaging is available from NHS Digital https://developer.nhs.uk/apis/dose-syntax-implementation/.

The free text Dose directions description is the form of dosage direction typically used in UK GP Systems.

Dose direction duration can be derived from the start and end dates if no other information is available.

When sharing Dose duration direction, the following examples are provided to clarify definitions for two of the coded text items which appear similar. In both cases, these directions are not an absolute instruction. They are:

  • ‘continue medication indefinitely’ - ongoing treatment planned for example when starting daily aspirin or a statin. There will be circumstances where you would stop them such as a GI (gastrointestinal) bleed.

  • ‘do not discontinue’ refers to medication where suddenly stopping could be dangerous, for example the abrupt withdrawal of long-term steroids.

The Medical devices element is for medical devices that cannot (in general) be prescribed and do not have representation in the NHS dictionary of medicines and medical devices (dm+d). Whilst medical devices that can be prescribed in primary care are generally well represented in dm+d, there are other kinds of devices used in hospital care which may not be so this section provides for this.
concept.description: Medications and medical devices

concept.name: medication_item_entry
concept.description: All medications and devices that can be prescribed to be entered via this Medication item entry. Handles details of continuation / addition / amendment of admission medications.

concept.name: medication_item_cluster
concept.description: Medication item cluster

concept.name: medication_name
concept.description: May be generic name or brand name.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for medication name
concept.valueSets: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP and AMPP concept classes

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: form
concept.description: The form of the medication e.g. capsule, drops, tablet, lotion etc.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for form.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000781000001107 | National Health Service dictionary of medicines and devices dose form simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: route
concept.description: The route by which the medication is administered e.g. oral, IM, IV

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for route
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - ^999000051000001100 |ePrescribing route of administration simple reference set (foundation metadata concept)|

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available

concept.name: site
concept.description: The anatomical site at which the medication is to be administered.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for site
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT: - <442083009 | Anatomical or acquired body structure (body structure) |

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used when code is not available

concept.name: method
concept.description: The technique or method by which the medication is to be administered.

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for method
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT : - ^999000041000001103 | ePrescribing method simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no coded text available

concept.name: over_the_counter_medication_flag
concept.description: Indicates if the medication or device is acquired without a prescription i.e. got by the person over the counter

concept.name: structured_dose_direction_cluster
concept.description: A structural representation of the elements carried by the dose syntax in 'parsable dose strength / timing' i.e. dose strength, dose timing, dose duration and maximum dose.

concept.name: structured_dose_amount
concept.description: A structural representation of dose amount, e.g. 20mg or 2 tablets. This element will generally only be used when persisting data within systems with 'parsable dose directions' being used to exchange the same information between systems. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital): https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

concept.name: dose
concept.description:
Amount of dose medication .Note that this specifies the quantity of the specified medication, not the quantity for each active ingredient(s). Each ingredient amount can be communicated in the Medication resource. For example, if one wants to communicate that a tablet was 375 mg, where the dose was one tablet, you can use the Medication
                                        resource to document that the tablet was comprised of 375 mg of drug XYZ. Alternatively if the dose was 375 mg, then you may only need to use the Medication resource to indicate this was a tablet. If the example were an IV such as dopamine and you wanted to communicate that 400mg of dopamine was mixed in 500 ml of some IV solution, then this would all be
                                        communicated in the Medication resource. If the administration is not intended to be instantaneous (rate is present or timing has a duration), this can be specified to convey the total amount to be administered over the period of time as indicated by the schedule e.g. 500 ml in dose, with timing used to convey that this should be done over 4 hours.

concept.name: rate
concept.description:
Amount of medication per unit of time. Identifies the speed with which the medication was or will be introduced into the patient. Typically the rate for an infusion e.g. 100 ml per 1 hour or 100 ml/hr. May also be expressed as a rate per unit of time e.g. 500 ml per 2 hours. Other examples: 200 mcg/min or 200 mcg/1 minute; 1 liter/8 hours.
                                        Sometimes, a rate can imply duration when expressed as total volume / duration (e.g. 500mL/2 hours implies a duration of 2 hours). However, when rate doesn't imply duration (e.g. 250mL/hour), then the timing.repeat.duration is needed to convey the infuse over time period.

concept.name: structured_dose_timing
concept.description: A slot containing a structural, computable representation of dose timing and maximum dose. This element will generally only be used when persisting data within systems with 'parsable dose directions' being used to exchange the same information between systems. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital): https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

concept.name: dose_duration_direction
concept.implementationGuidance:
When sharing Dose duration direction, the following examples are provided to clarify definitions for two of the coded text items which appear similar. In both cases, these directions are not an absolute instruction. They are:

  • ‘continue medication indefinitely’ - ongoing treatment planned for example when starting daily aspirin or a statin. There will be circumstances where you would stop them such as a GI (gastrointestinal) bleed.

  • ‘do not discontinue’ refers to medication where suddenly stopping could be dangerous, for example the abrupt withdrawal of long-term steroids.
concept.description: Recommendation of the time period for which the medication should be continued, including direction not to discontinue. As per FHIR Dose Syntax Implementation Guidance (NHS Digital): https://simplifier.net/guide/DoseSyntaxImplementationGuidanceforFHIRR4/Home

concept.name: dose_directions_description
concept.description: Describes the entire medication dosage and administration directions including dose quantity and medication frequency and optionally duration e.g. “1 tablet at night" or “2mg at 10pm”.

concept.name: additional_instructions
concept.description: Allows for: requirements for adherence support, e.g. compliance aids, prompts and packaging requirements, additional information about specific medicines e.g. where specific brand required, person requirements, e.g. unable to swallow tablets.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Additional instruction

concept.name: course_details_cluster
concept.description: Details of the overall course of medication.

concept.name: course_status
concept.description: The status of this prescription.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : - Medication status

concept.name: indication
concept.description: Reason for medication being prescribed, where known.

concept.name: start_datetime
concept.description: The date and/or time that the medication course should begin.

concept.name: end_datetime
concept.description: The date and/or time that the medication course should finish.

concept.name: link_to_indication_record
concept.description: A link to the record which contains the indication for this medication order.

concept.name: commentrecommendation
concept.description: Suggestions about duration and/or review, ongoing monitoring requirements, advice on starting, discontinuing or changing medication. Additional comment or recommendation about the medication course e.g. 'Patient named supply', 'unlicensed medication', 'Foreign brand' or monitoring recommendations

concept.name: medication_change_summary_cluster
concept.description: Records the changes made to medication.

concept.name: status
concept.description: The nature of any change made to the medication.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set : Medication status

concept.name: indication
concept.description: Reason for change in medication, e.g. sub-therapeutic dose, person intolerant.
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: date_of_change
concept.description: The date of the change - addition, or amendment

concept.name: description_of_amendment
concept.description: Where a change is made to the medication i.e. one drug stopped and another started or eg dose, frequency or route is changed.

concept.name: total_dose_daily_quantity
concept.description: The total daily dose of this medication. This is helpful for estimating optimal adherence to dosing guidance. It may be computed from product/dose strength and frequency or entered manually.

concept.name: medical_devices_entry
concept.description: Medical devices

concept.name: medical_device
concept.description: Any medical device that isn't prescribed.

concept.name: comments
concept.implementationGuidance: Implementation guidance
concept.description: Any information regarding the medical device.

concept.name: medication_discontinued_entry
concept.description: Medication discontinued entry

concept.name: name_of_discontinued_medication
concept.description: The name of the medication or medical device being discontinued

concept.name: coded_value
concept.description: The coded value for medication name
concept.valueSets: dm+d:- any code from the VTM, VMP, AMP, VMPP and AMPP concept classes

concept.name: free_text
concept.description: Free text field to be used if no code is available.

concept.name: status
concept.description: The status of any change made to the medication. MUST CONTAIN STOPPED.
concept.valueSets: FHIR value set: - Medication status

concept.name: indication
concept.description: The clinical indication for any changes in medication status
concept.valueSets: SNOMED CT:- ^1127601000000107 | Healthcare matters simple reference set (foundation metadata concept) |

concept.name: date_of_change
concept.description: The date of the discontinuation

concept.name: comment
concept.description: Any additional comment about the discontinuation or amendment.

concept.name: plan_and_requested_actions
concept.description: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the person or their legitimate representative.

concept.name: plan_and_requested_actions_record_entry
concept.implementationGuidance:
This is the treatment plan for the treating team or clinician and any actions requested. This plan should make clear who is expected to take responsibility for actions following an encounter, for example the person receiving care or their carer; the GP or another heath care professional. <br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/>For example, follow up renal function test to be arranged by the GP within two weeks of appointment. Shared decision-making principles should apply to the development of the plan and where the person’s opinions differ, this should be included under ‘Agreed with the person or their legitimate person representative’ which will include both the aspects of the plan the person (or their representative) agree with and the aspects they disagree with. <br clear="none"/>
                                <br clear="none"/> The section would allow for the recording of planned investigations, procedures and treatment for the person’s identified conditions and priorities. This is not a care plan it is a plan for specific actions to be carried out as a result of an encounter.<br clear="none"/>
concept.description: This is a plan and requested actions record entry. There may be 0 to many record entries under a section. Each record entry is made up of a number of elements or data items.

concept.name: actions_for_professionals
concept.description:
Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a person's identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including the person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location,
                            strategies.

concept.name: actions_for_person_or_their_carer
concept.description: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including person’s expectations. A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies.

concept.name: agreed_with_the_person_or_their_legitimate_representative
concept.description: Indicates whether the person or their legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments. A record of the agreement of the decisions made.

concept.name: outcome_of_plan_and_requested_actions
concept.description: The details of the outcome of the plan and requested actions.
